eu.greenlightning.hypercubepdf.align

Class HCPAligned

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.greenlightning.hypercubepdf.align.HCPAligned
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HCPElement

    public class HCPAligned
extends Object
implements HCPElement
    An HCPElement wrapper which aligns the element inside the shape in which it is painted.

    Calls to getWidth() and getHeight() are delegated to the element.

    The element will be painted using the width returned by it's getWidth() method and it will be aligned in the target shape using the specified horizontal alignment. However, if the element is wider than the target shape, then it will be painted using the width of the target shape making alignment not necessary. The same logic is applied independently to the element's height calling it's getHeight() method.

    If no alignment is specified (withHorizontalAlignment() does not specify a vertical alignment and withVerticalAlignment() does not specify a horizontal alignment), then the element is painted using the size of the shape.

    Please refer to the documentation of the static factory methods of this class for specific descriptions of the alignment process.

    This class is immutable.

    • Method Detail

      • withHorizontalAlignment

        public static HCPAligned withHorizontalAlignment(HCPElement element,
                                                 HCPHorizontalAlignment horizontal)
        Aligns the element horizontally.

        The element will be painted using the width returned by it's getWidth() method and it will be aligned in the target shape using the specified horizontal alignment. However, if the element is wider than the target shape, then it will be painted using the width of the target shape making alignment not necessary. The element will always be painted using the height of the target shape.

        Parameters:
        element - not null
        horizontal - not null
        Returns:
        a wrapper for element with the specified horizontal alignment
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if element or horizontal is null

      • withVerticalAlignment

        public static HCPAligned withVerticalAlignment(HCPElement element,
                                               HCPVerticalAlignment vertical)
        Aligns the element vertically.

        The element will be painted using the height returned by it's getHeight() method and it will be aligned in the target shape using the specified vertical alignment. However, if the element is higher than the target shape, then it will be painted using the height of the target shape making alignment not necessary. The element will always be painted using the width of the target shape.

        Parameters:
        element - not null
        vertical - not null
        Returns:
        a wrapper for element with the specified vertical alignment
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if element or vertical is null

      • withAlignment

        public static HCPAligned withAlignment(HCPElement element,
                                       HCPAlignment alignment)
        Aligns the element both horizontally and vertically.

        The element will be painted using the width returned by it's getWidth() method and it will be aligned in the target shape using the specified horizontal alignment. However, if the element is wider than the target shape, then it will be painted using the width of the target shape making alignment not necessary. The same logic is applied independently to the element's height calling it's getHeight() method.

        This operation is equivalent to calling:

        HCPAligned.withAlignment(element, alignment.getHorizontalAlignment(), alignment.getVerticalAlignment());

        Parameters:
        element - not null
        alignment - not null
        Returns:
        a wrapper for element with the specified alignment
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if element or alignment is null
        See Also:
        withAlignment(HCPElement, HCPHorizontalAlignment, HCPVerticalAlignment), HCPAlignment.getHorizontalAlignment(), HCPAlignment.getVerticalAlignment()

      • withAlignment

        public static HCPAligned withAlignment(HCPElement element,
                                       HCPHorizontalAlignment horizontal,
                                       HCPVerticalAlignment vertical)
        Aligns the element both horizontally and vertically.

        The element will be painted using the width returned by it's getWidth() method and it will be aligned in the target shape using the specified horizontal alignment. However, if the element is wider than the target shape, then it will be painted using the width of the target shape making alignment not necessary. The same logic is applied independently to the element's height calling it's getHeight() method.

        This operation is equivalent to calling:

        HCPAligned.withAlignment(element, HCPAlignment.valueOf(horizontal, vertical));

        Parameters:
        element - not null
        horizontal - not null
        vertical - not null
        Returns:
        a wrapper for element with the specified horizontal and vertical alignment
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if element, horizontal or vertical is null
        See Also:
        withAlignment(HCPElement, HCPAlignment), HCPAlignment.valueOf(HCPHorizontalAlignment, HCPVerticalAlignment)

      • paint

        public void paint(PDPageContentStream content,
                  PDRectangle parentShape)
           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: HCPElement
        Paints this element to the specified PDPageContentStream.

        Shape defines the position and size which should be used for painting. If the size is less than specified by HCPElement.getWidth() and HCPElement.getHeight() then this method does not guarantee that (a) the requested size is used or (b) the element is painted correctly or (c) the element is painted at all.

        Specified by:
        paint in interface HCPElement
        Parameters:
        content - not null
        parentShape - not null
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error writing to the stream
